tool.name: OSMGPRelationLoader

param.name: in_osmRelationFile
param.dialogReference: OpenStreetMap file containing the relation elements to load in the XML format.
param.pythonReference: OpenStreetMap file containing the relation elements to load in the XML format.

param.name: in_loadSuperRelation
param.dialogReference:
The parameter determines what types of relations, either relations or super-relations are loaded.

  • DO_NOT_LOAD_SUPER_RELATION Only load the relations composed of ways. This is the default.

  • LOAD_SUPER_RELATION Only super-relations composed of ways and relations are loaded. This option should only be used after the relations have been loaded.
param.pythonReference:
The parameter determines what types of relations, either relations or super-relations are loaded.

  • DO_NOT_LOAD_SUPER_RELATION Only load the relations composed of ways. This is the default.

  • LOAD_SUPER_RELATION Only super-relations composed of ways and relations are loaded. This option should only be used after the relations have been loaded.

param.name: in_SourceOSMLines
param.dialogReference: Source line feature class representing the already loaded ways and relations. The lines were loaded with the OSM Way Loader tool.
param.pythonReference: Source line feature class representing the already loaded ways and relations. The lines were loaded with the OSM Way Loader tool.

param.name: in_SourceOSMPolygons
param.dialogReference: Source polygon feature class representing the already loaded ways and relations. The polygons were loaded with the OSM Way Loader tool.
param.pythonReference: Source polygon feature class representing the already loaded ways and relations. The polygons were loaded with the OSM Way Loader tool.

param.name: in_polyline_fieldNames
param.displayname: Relation tag keys to load for line features
param.dialogReference: Streamline the loading of relation tags into attributes for linear features. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').
param.pythonReference: Streamline the loading of relation tags into attributes for linear features. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

param.name: in_polygon_fieldNames
param.displayname: Relation tag keys to load for polygon features
param.dialogReference: Streamline the loading of relation tags into attributes for polygon features. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').
param.pythonReference: Streamline the loading of relation tags into attributes for polygon features. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

param.name: out_osmLines
param.dialogReference: Name of the output line feature class. This feature class contains the relation elements determined to represent a line feature.
param.pythonReference: Name of the output line feature class. This feature class contains the relation elements determined to represent a line feature.

param.name: out_osmPolygons
param.dialogReference: Name of the output polygon feature class. This feature class contains the relation elements determined to represent a polygon feature.
param.pythonReference: Name of the output polygon feature class. This feature class contains the relation elements determined to represent a polygon feature.

tool.summary: This tool loads relations from a OpenStreetMap XML file into a geodatabase and creates line and polygon features from the content.
tool.usage:
• The tool is used in combination with the OSM File Loadertool.

  • The tool tool only processes the relation elements from the OpenStreetMap source file. It is assumed that the ways already exist as line and polygon features.

  • The tool processes <way> and <relation> item elements for the <relation> element. In order for the relation to be loaded and have a geometric representation is needs to be either a line or a polygon feature.

  • If a tag <tag k='type' v='route' /> exists then the resulting geometry is a line. In other cases the resulting geometry depends on the geometry type of the way item or the connectedness of all way items.

  • Streamline the loading of tags into attributes. If no tags are provided, a set of default tags is used. The default set consists of ('name', 'highway', 'building', 'natural', 'waterway', 'amenity', 'landuse', 'place', 'railway', 'boundary','power','leisure','man_made', 'shop', 'tourism', 'route', 'barrier', 'surface', 'type', 'service', 'sport').

scriptExample.title: Loading relation elements to
scriptExample.para: Load the relation elements from the OpenStreetMap XML file into line and polygon feature classes. The source line and polygon feature classes are already loaded by using the OSM Way Loadertool.
scriptExample.code:
# load the arcpy module import arcpy
# load the OpenStreetMap toolbox arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'C:\Program Files (x86)\ArcGIS\Desktop10.3\ArcToolbox\Toolboxes\OpenStreetMap Toolbox.tbx')
# source line feature class source_line_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_ln'
# source polygon feature class source_polygon_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_ply'
# target line feature class target_line_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_r_ln'
# target polygon feature class target_polygon_fc = r'D:\OSM\country.gdb\liechtenstein_r_ply'
# OpenStreetMap XML file osm_source = r'D:\OSM\liechtenstein-relations.osm'
# load the relation elements into lines and polygons for Liechtenstein arcpy.OSMGPRelationLoader_osmtools(osm_source, 'DO_NOT_LOAD_SUPER_RELATION', source_line_fc, source_polygon_fc, '#', '#', target_line_fc, target_polygon_fc)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool loads relations from a OpenStreetMap XML file into a geodatabase and creates line and polygon features from the content.
